Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-PMb (XXA, UCLL1c, Phe-rich, natural AMPs, frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: skin secretion, the Amazon River frog, Lithobates palmipes (Ranidae), Brazil, South America

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: isolated from skin secretion via RP-HPLC.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (92.31%) toTemporin-PMaF: 31%, L: 23%. GRAVY: 1.538, mol Wt: 1485.832, mol formula: C78H112N14O15, mol ex coeff: 0. It differs from Temporin-PMa only at a single position, F for this peptide and L for AP3610 (PMa).Chemical modification:  C-terminal amidation.Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 16 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (MIC 16 uM) but KPC strain MIC>128 uM AMP-resistant?  P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 32 uM) also MDR MIC>128 uM AMP-resistant?, and S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 8 uM) also MRSA MIC>128 uM AMP-resistant? Bacterial resistant strains: A. baunmannii MDR (MIC 8 uM).Cytotoxicity:  cytotoxic to HeLa (IC50 32.4 uM) and MCF7 cancer cells (IC50 24.1 uM), keratinocytes (IC50 25.0 uM), and highly hemolytic above 64 uM (HC50 32-64 uM) but poorly hemolytic at 16 uM or less.SAR:  The peptide lost activity without C-terminal amidation.
Literature Information.Author: Barbosa GG, de Santana CJC, Silva TL, Santana BCG, Paiva PMG, de Freitas GG, Brand GD, Júnior ORP, Castro MS, Napoleão TH. 2024
Literature Information.Reference: Comp Biochem Physiol B Biochem Mol Biol. 2024 Oct 18:111041. doi: 10.1016/j.cbpb.2024.111041.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: A new temporin with antibacterial activity and cytotoxicity from the skin secretion of Lithobates palmipes (Spix, 1824) (Amphibia: Ranidae) from Brazilian Atlantic Forest.
